attributes.action: get rid of the pointless system of IR35 which raises little tax but makes it harder for contractors to operate.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Through its FOIA request, the PCG has established that the Government raised just £9.2m from IR35 in the tax years 2002/3 to 2007/8. No wonder the Government said it didn’t know how much revenue it earned from IR35 when asked in Parliament and elsewhere.

It is raising just £1.5m a year from the tax, a tiny amount in terms of the tax burden. Some people spend more than that on a party. The Government had expected to raise £220m a year in National Insurance contributions alone – never mind the extra income tax.

It is time to get of this pointless regulation.
